section.section: The State Board consists of 9 members appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.

Of the 9 members of the State Board:
6 shall be licensed master electricians; and
3 shall be consumer members.
The consumer members shall be from the State at large.
A member of the State Board may not reside in the same county as another member.

text.section: Each member of the State Board shall be a citizen and resident of the State.

Each master electrician member of the State Board shall:
hold an active State license; and
be engaged actively in providing electrical services as a master electrician for at least 5 consecutive years immediately before appointment.

While a member of the State Board, a consumer member may not:
have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the State Board; or
grade an examination given by or for the State Board.
Before taking office, each appointee to the State Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 3 years and begins on July 1.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the State Board on October 1, 1989.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member may not be reappointed for more than 2 consecutive 3-year terms.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
